    this afternoon if you need me.==================== ATTACHMENT   1 ==================

                                                                    Hex-Dump Conversion
Congressional Movement on Tobacco

Senator Hatch announced Wednesday that he wants to introduce a "discussion bill" enforcing a
national tobacco settlement before Congress adjourns for the year. Hatch said the bill would be
modeled on -- but not identical to -- the deal negotiated between the tobacco industry and the
state attorneys general. Hatch said his goal was to craft a bill that could have bipartisan support.
  Senator Kennedy may also offer a bill before Congress adjourns next month. Senator
Lautenberg and James Hansen (R-UT) introduced a tobacco bill Wednesday that would cost
$494 billion. The proposal gives cigarette makers no relief from lawsuits, which was
presumably their reason for entering into the June 20th settlement. A bill introduced last week
by House members Chris Cox (R-CA), Scott McInnis (R-CO) and Paul McHale (D-PA) would
limit fees paid to attorneys involved in the June 20th settlement to $150 per hour plus expenses.
